overall_feedback: The candidate struggled to provide in-depth answers to technical questions, indicating a basic understanding of SQL concepts. Behavioral skills were not demonstrated sufficiently, leading to low scores in both categories.

behavioural_skill.feedback: The candidate did not demonstrate any analytical or problem-solving skills in the interview.
There was no evidence of effective communication or collaboration skills shown during the interview.
The candidate failed to highlight any relevant experience regarding attention to detail in database tasks.

tech_skill_evaluations.feedback: The candidate provided a basic definition of normalization and denormalization but lacked depth in explaining goals, normal forms, and trade-offs. Overall, the understanding of concepts was very minimal.
The candidate did not address any concepts related to NoSQL databases.
There were no relevant answers provided regarding database performance tuning.
The candidate did not discuss any concepts related to database security and backup strategies.
No discussion or examples were provided about scripting for database tasks.
The candidate did not provide any examples of a proactive approach to improving database processes.
